titleStmt.title: Despatch from Owen L. W. Smith to David J. Hill, March 24, 1899

bibl.title: Despatch from Owen L. W. Smith to David J. Hill
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

correspAction.roleName: U.S. Minister Resident and Consul General

div1.p:
No. 25. Consular Series.
Legation of the United States,
Monrovia Liberia,
March 24, 1899.

Owen L. W. Smith
To
Hon. David J. Hill,
Assistant Secretary of State,
Washington.

I have the honor to transmit, herewith, a supplemental, statistical report, relative to the Cape Coast Castle Consular Agency. This supplemental report, recovers the last 3 quarters of 1897, including all of 1898 and January of 1899.

In submitting, a partial, statistical report of the Republic of Liberia, in my "Consular," dispatch of Oct. 7, 1898. I referred
referred to the impracticability of giving a full report before the assemblying of the Legislature in December 1898; and promised to send a supplemental report after that date. I have to inform you that we have made several efforts to obtain the desired information, but have in every case been told by the Comptroller, that it could not be furnished, as he was not in possession of same.

I have the honor to be
your obedient servant;
Owen L. W. Smith
M. R. and C. General.

Inclosure
Letter &c. of 2nd Mar. 1899, from Colonial Secretary, Accra Gold Coast.
div1.ab:
No. 1143/99.
In case of reply the number and date of this letter should be quoted.

Colonial Secretary's Office.
Accra. Gold Coast.
2nd March 1899
div1.p: I am directed by His Excellency the Acting Governor to acknowledge your letter of the 14th ultimo, and beg to forward you a tabulated statement giving the information you ask for.

I am,
Sir,
Your Obedient Servant,
G. B. Haddon Smith
Acting Colonial Secretary

O. L. W. Smith, Esqre.
Minister Resident & Consul General
of the United States to Liberia,
United State's Legation.
Monrovia,
Liberia.
Tonnage, value of imports to, and Exports from the Colony declared for the United States since the 30th June 1897 to February 1899.

row.cell: Date of arrival in the Colony
Date of departure from the Colony
Value of Imports into the Colony
Value of Exports from the Colony for the United States.

div1.p:
F. W. Major
Comptroller of Customs.
